title: OM House / AN NAM Architecture
description: OM House is a private villa for a family including parents, son, and daughter. Located in an urban area with a high density of buildings, adjacent to dusty and noisy highways, with the desire to find tranquility and harmony with nature, the house is designed with a closed facade and a big garden inside, creating a green space inside the city.
author: Valeria Silva

title: Concept House / Joao de Barro Arquitetura
description: In Patrocínio, Minas Gerais, stands a residence that redefines the concept of contemporary living, harmonizing the lightness of a metal structure with the solidity of stone and the warmth of cumaru wood. This exemplary project was meticulously designed to establish a deep connection with the lush natural surroundings, offering a sophisticated refuge that is intrinsically linked to its environment.

title: A Mid-Century Modern Home Reimagined for a Family in California
description: In the hills of Palo Alto, California, an iconic Eichler home has been respectfully transformed by architect-artist Gustave Carlson. Originally built in 1971 and custom-commissioned by architect John S. Lynd, a personal friend of Joseph Eichler, the home carries a rare pedigree among the region’s mid-century residences. Today, it belongs to a couple with four daughters and an expansive art collection, much of it by emerging female artists. Carlson’s thoughtful update bridges past and present, enhancing the home’s functionality while preserving its optimistic spirit.
author: Erin

title: Could This Be the Most Instagrammable Hotel in the Paris?
description: In the heart of Paris, Villa M is a new approach to city buildings. Designed by Triptyque Architecture with spaces curated by Philippe Starck, this mixed-use complex blends hospitality, healthcare, and sustainability into a lush urban destination.
author: Erin

title: The YMK Residence Brings Layered Living to the Karuizawa Highlands
description: Takeshi Hirobe Architects designs the YMK house in Karuizawa, Japan across six levels that follow its dramatically sloped, rural highland site.
author: Caroline Williamson

title: A Maui Home Blends Modern Minimalism With Climate-Conscious Design
description: A compact home in Maui by Hawaii Off Grid blends modern minimalism with climate-conscious design, featuring a sculptural roof and timber construction.
